newsitem.title: VATICAN: Vatican synod on Americas to start in November.
newsitem.headline: Vatican synod on Americas to start in November.

text.p: A special synod of Roman Catholic bishops from North and South America will take place at the Vatican from November 16 to December 12, the Vatican said on Wednesday.

Pope John Paul has called the synod to discuss how Catholics should prepare for Christianity's third millennium. He has called a gathering of bishops from Europe on the same theme although no date has been set.
Wednesday's statement said the Pontiff had appointed three senior clerics as co-chairmen of the Americas synod.

They are Cardinal Roger Mahony, the archbishop of Los Angeles, Cardinal Eugenio de Araujo Sales, the archbishop of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, and Monsignor Dario Castrillon Hoyos, a Colombian and the head of the Vatican's Congregation for the Clergy.
Synods are gatherings that advise the Pope on various issues of Church life. He usually uses the findings of the gatherings as the basis of a major document.
